Absolutely keep refilling it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="2138111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=2138111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2137219" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2137219" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yzy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2110998"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2110998.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="yzy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2137219ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2137219" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2110998">yzy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-26">04/26/24 12:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the dry down is really nice</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="2137219"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=2137219#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2134875" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2134875" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DFWscent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2061440"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2061440.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DFWscent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2134875ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2134875" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2061440">DFWscent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-24">04/24/24 08:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is my very first Le Labo purchase. I bought it for the following: fragrance, look, and experience. I tested this scent by purchasing a sample through Microperfumes. I didn't want to go to my local Le Labo boutique until I was ready to purchase something. I wanted to save the full experience when I made my purchase. I tested this scent right after I took a shower and got ready for bed. By the time I woke up the next morning, I woke up to smelling this scent all over me. It was refreshing and opened my senses to a new day. I was immediately in love with this scent. Later that morning, I sprayed myself with it to see how long it would last. I was surprised that it lasted for at least 6-7 hours. To me, the scent would come and go. Now and then it would subtly hit me. It's an interesting scent. It changes now and then between the mid-tones and has a nice dry-down. It's creamy and woody at times. I can also smell a little smoky quality and spiciness. Now, I'm not a woodsy fragrance type of guy but this one sold me. I've learned to be very selective before I make a purchase. If you're going to spend over $300 you better be sure you like the scent. <br />
<br />
The look of the bottle is simple and minimalistic. I like that. It's straight and to the point. What I love is that they make it so personal by mixing the scent right in front of you. They prepare and label it with whatever you want it to say. The experience is like no other. My sales associate, Hunter, was so nice and we had a great conversation about Le Labo. He told me a short history of Le Labo while he mixed my scent. He knew exactly what he was doing and that they were fully trained to follow a strict preparation process. Hunter even put his name on my bottle label showing that he was the SA that mixed my scent. I thought that was so cool. That way I can always refer to him whenever I'm ready to make another Le Labo purchase. At the time of writing this review, my bottle is only 3 days old. I've heard that one would need to allow the scent to steep for a few days or up to 14 days to get the full effect. I compared it to my sample and the sample smells so much stronger. You can tell that the sample was beyond its steeping duration. So if you purchase this scent, they say to give it some time to steep. <br />
<br />
Overall, I like this scent as an everyday scent. It's a niche scent so expect to pay a hefty amount. I purchased the 100ml along with their full Discovery Set of scents so I could try all of them on my skin. Testing scents on your skin is the best way to see how well it compliments your body chemistry. My next purchase will be Bergamote 22 which I'm looking forward to. I highly recommend this scent for both sexes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="2134875"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=2134875#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2134527" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; No pickle juice detected. My only problem is the longevity- I get about 3 hrs max, not sure if its my batch or the quality I got.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="2134527"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=2134527#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130339" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Comparisons to pickles, cat pee, dust, wet dog, hardware store lumber, unpleasant leather, air fresheners...none of these things smell remotely the same and hardly anyone seems to agree on why it's bad. No pun intended but something about a handful of the negative reviews doesn't pass the smell test for me. I'll update if I ever get my nose on it, but it might be wise to take chatter about this scent with a grain of salt--both positive and negative</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; On my skin the opening was okay. Smelled like fresh cucumbers. <br />
After a while all I smelled was leather. I smelled like a leather shop and did not like it at all. <br />
The scent has long longevity and big sillage. It holds really well. Which was awful because I hated it and couldn’t bare it. <br />
Don’t understand the hype tbh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="2127654"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=2127654#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2125876" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1696143">eriksatt94</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-10">04/10/24 16:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Walgreens has a clone of this and it smells really great. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2119187" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheFragranceGirlie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/321022"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheFragranceGirlie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Eyes-Closed-76339.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76339.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eyes Closed"title="Eyes Closed"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2119187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2119187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/321022">TheFragranceGirlie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-09">04/09/24 07:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I finally ordered a sample of Santal 33, because of course we try before we buy, and I am still conflicted as to how I feel about it. I read all of the reviews about how it smells like pickles; however, I am happy to report, I did not smell like pickle juice at any point! LOL I think this is a nice, clean, "out-the-shower" fragrance but I am unsure as to whether or not this is full bottle worthy. Honestly, I think that this is a great unisex fragrance but I would pass on purchasing a full bottle. - 7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="2119187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=2119187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2118302" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2118302" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="scentedddiary"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1356152"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1356152.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="scentedddiary" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2118302ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2118302" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1356152">scentedddiary</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-08">04/08/24 11:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yesterday I went out to dinner with friends and at the end of the night two women literally chased me down the street to ask me what I was wearing. I often get complimented for my fragrances, but to be literally almost followed home (lol) - I've never had that happen to me before. It's a classic for a reason! Such a cool girl scent. <br />
Also, I know some people complain that it's overplayed - maybe in new york city, but I fortunately live in the south of Italy so no one ever smells like me. Yay :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="2118302"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=2118302#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2118180" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The lasting leathery scent is MUCH MUCH stronger than the opening. I made the mistake of spraying it on my wrists just before having a meal… I felt like throwing up every time I lifted my fork and brought it close to my face with each bite…</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;             </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1060842" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1060842" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maidenless"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1187137"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1187137.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maidenless" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Patchouli-Paris-95161.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95161.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Patchouli Paris"title="Patchouli Paris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1060842ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1060842" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1187137">Maidenless</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-15">05/15/19 22:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Okay I can see why Santal 33 is such a polarizing perfume. To be completely honest, this fragrance was so hyped that I felt like I needed to order a sample to see how it went, and I did. It was an instant scrubber for me. The dill + scrap metal combo from the start was so repulsive and revolting that I didn't give it enough time to shine.. <br />
<br />
The second use however, was heaven on earth! The opening was still harsh indeed, but somehow more bearable, no more scrap metal, just dill and something very dry and green...(papyrus I think ?) Santal 33 then developed into this slightly green floral-woody combo on my skin although the woodiness was amplified on clothes which got creamier and creamier throughout the day but still managed to retain the dryness and airiness from the beginning and that's when I knew I had to order a FB. Absolutely stunning! <br />
<br />
P/s: To all the ones who show prejudice towards Santal 33, if you hate this because of the smell then I totally get it, but if you do so due to the fact that it's so popular and a little hyped up then you're pathetic. I do agree that their offerings are a bit too pricey but the juice quality DOES justify the price tag, so far I've tried this one, Rose 31, Iris 39, The Noir 29 and they're all unique in their own terms ( although the performance on Rose 31 is a bit of a joke ). Also, don't judge people for their choices of scents, let's not make this community toxic folks! :-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="1060842"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=1060842#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1139911" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1139911" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kaylanorma"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1218644"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1218644.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kaylanorma" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Ani-54785.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54785.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ani"title="Ani"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1139911ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1139911" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1218644">kaylanorma</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-30">01/30/20 17:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The anti-hype fragrance. <br />
<br />
And by that I mean, the trend for Santal is to express how basic and ubiquitous it is, how your own delicate sensibilities are so refined that you wouldn't be caught DEAD *gasp* in a major city wearing the dreaded Santal 33!<br />
<br />
Well, I've got news for you, folks. We don't all live in New York or LA, and some of us have never smelled this magic anywhere before. And for those of us like myself, who ordered the $6 sample from Le Labo to see what all of the love and hate were about, this mesmerizing, sharp, and polarizing blend of (mostly) papyrus, violet leaf, cardamom, and cedar smells intoxicating.<br />
<br />
If you are looking for a sandalwood fragrance, this is not the one for you. But if you are looking for something loud, exotic, and piercing, and you DON'T live in New York or LA, get a sample and give it a shot.<br />
<br />
I can't promise you that you won't get hit with a huge animalic waft of deer piss or "dill" on the opening, but I also can't promise you that you won't love it for that very reason and end up buying a full bottle like I did.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="1139911"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=1139911#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1572008" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1572008" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="R.C.Bullar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509779"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1509779.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="R.C.Bullar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1572008ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1572008" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509779">R.C.Bullar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-27">05/27/22 05:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the best niche fragrances ever.<br />
An absolute masterpiece from Frank Voelkl!<br />
<br />
Anyone who says Santal 33 smells like “Dill pickle” has snorted too much substance in their smeller.<br />
(haha kidding but not really) <br />
<br />
I get a fresh Cucumber smell within this fragrance but that is nowhere even close to the smell of a vinegary dill pickle. People are crazy.<br />
<br />
My breakdown <br />
<br />
Fresh cucumber with cardamom and a little hint of mint in the opening. Then the fragrance changes towards a strong cedar note with the mint lingering and the fresh cucumber dying down. Then the magic happens at about the 2-3 hour mark of wearing this perfume it turns into the most beautiful Cedar, iris, musk, and vanilla dry down. The vanilla just keeps the fragrance from being to sharp and it never really “shows itself” but my oh my the dry down is just to die for. <br />
<br />
A true masterpiece and it’s far more unheard of than the niche community would like you to believe. In my experience nobody who has asked me about my fragrance, has even heard of Santal 33 or Le Labo and I wore it everyday for nearly a year and received many, many compliments. <br />
<br />
I will never not love this fragrance <br />
I own so many fragrances now that it gets less wear time these days, but I’ll never forget the fragrance that started my niche journey and I very well could have ended with and that is Santal 33</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="1572008"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=1572008#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent900968" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc900968" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maureen.mccabe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1113777"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1113777.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maureen.mccabe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma900968ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd900968" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1113777">maureen.mccabe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-01-15">01/15/18 12:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Driving down Highway 1 near the Pacific Ocean, through redwood and eucalyptus trees, a dense fog carrying a woody, salty, electric sea air - a very distinct smell that anyone who has driven in northern California would know. That is all I can think of when wearing this perfume, and so for me it's a winner. <br />
<br />
Everyone's chemistry is different, so not everyone will like it. And who cares if it's trendy, or hated, or polarizing. It's sad to see people talking ignorantly and judging those who enjoy this perfume. I am anything but vapid or a follower of trends, I recently came across this brand by walking through a department store and nobody told me to try it, I just sampled all the Le Labo on my skin and kept coming back to this one.<br />
<br />
Not everyone will like this perfume, not everyone will smell the redwood trees and fog like I do, but for some of us I think Santal 33 is comforting and memory-inducing in a fantastic way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="900968"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=900968#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1160499" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1160499" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ateneo_ldb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068097"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1068097.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ateneo_ldb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/The-Last-Day-Of-Summer-Eau-de-Parfum-53090.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53090.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum"title="The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1160499ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1160499" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068097">ateneo_ldb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-02">04/02/20 22:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Santal 33 was the first niche fragrance I bought, and what launched my nosedive into the world of niche, into my "fragrance journey." I hardly wear it now since the comments went from "you smell really good" to "you smell like that one perfume," which has ruined me from wearing it out in public. But after all these years, I can still say that my love for this fragrance has not waned.<br />
<br />
Hundreds of bottles and samples later, I can finally pinpoint what I love about this fragrance in three words--green, leather, iris. I used to think it was sandalwood, and to be fair, my nose does detect the sandalwood in here, but to me, this is more about iris. Admittedly, I'm not familiar with most Iris perfumes, but in Santal 33, iris is never powdery or lipsticky as I've smelled it in others. It's leathery and a little bit earthy, something that's comes across clearly in the iris of Cire Trudon's Bruma. Blended with the dry herbalness of papyrus, cardamom, and the woodsiness of sandalwood, the fragrance becomes, I believe, greater than the sum of it's parts. It does open very harsh, but the drydown to me, is beyond worth it. And this fragrance is tenacious as hell! On my skin, it's an until next morning kind of smell. I even spritzed a tiny bit on for this review, then took a shower, and it's still going strong.<br />
<br />
Santal 33 is deceptively simple, and that is what makes it a success. Chris Bartlett, the perfumer for Zoologist's Elephant said in an interview once that a perfume should smell like itself. If you can easily pick apart its ingredients, then it's only a blend. In that regard, I think Santal 33 is a massive achievement. In my fragrance journey, I haven't come across many fragrances that smell as singular and as unique. <br />
<br />
Some days I do find myself wishing it would decline in popularity. It's so odious to wear an "it" perfume. But I think for a lot of us, we don't wear perfumes for other people, we wear it for ourselves. Like finding a perfect jacket, or wearing the perfect outfit for the day, it's almost like an extension of yourself.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="1160499"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=1160499#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="12201" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent912644" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc912644" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iobhai"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1118560"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1118560.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="iobhai" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/TSVGA-Parfums/Osmanthus-Toboggan-66696.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66696.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Osmanthus Toboggan"title="Osmanthus Toboggan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma912644ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd912644" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1118560">iobhai</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-17">02/17/18 07:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>You're a rabbit. You live in a dead garden. Your entire diet consists of unremarkable weeds, poison ivy/oak/sumac, and the occasional poisonous flower blossom. But, this isn't just any garden, because its owner decided to plant a bunch of cucumbers this year. So, you're a rabbit. You live in a mostly dead garden. Your entire diet consists of raw cucumbers, unremarkable weeds, poison ivy/oak/sumac, and the occasional poisonous flower blossom. The best part is that every so often you get to munch on all of these things after they've been spritzed with an insecticide. Santal 33 by Le Labo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="912644"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=912644#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent841421" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc841421" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jeji2c"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/217957"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.217957.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jeji2c" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pierre-Balmain/Monsieur-Balmain-3819.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3819.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Monsieur Balmain"title="Monsieur Balmain"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma841421ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd841421" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/217957">jeji2c</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-07-14">07/14/17 19:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First thing first, much as I would like to be subjective, this is a negative review towards Santal 33 from a personal point of view. Hence should you be concerned that it might hurt your feeling for the perfume, it is my advice to stop reading here.  Or else, if attempts would be made to hear something different, the following description may be helpful.<br />
<br />
Santal or sandalwood in far-eastern (China, Japan and Korea) conception is usually associated with tranquility, meditation and introspection due to its calming and soothing effcet—woody with a distinctive creamy touch.  Of course the sandalwood aforementioned is limited to Santalum album (Indian sandalwood, Mysore sandalwood or other names).  Another fact is, the wood chunks harvested from aged trees, say 60 years old, vary too.  Heart wood close to root or ground is of the best quality with slightly darker colour and creamier woody scent.  Yet wood adjacent to the bark part has its value too with lighter and more saw-dust-like scent.  But please be kindly noted, either requires a proper aging process to achieve its scent of prime.  A perfect example is Tam Dao EDP by Diptyque, for me, the consecutive top, heart and base notes capture exactly the layers of scent from bark to heart, as time passes it evolves from dry and cedar-like to the creamy sweet woody aura.<br />
<br />
It is commonly understood a perfume is not an imitation but an interpretation of the artist's observation and thoughts of nature, the conclusion certainly should apply to Santal 33.  However, I personally dislike it because it reveals less sandalwood than other elements, namely papyrus and leather.  If you are not familiar with the former, try to pick up the green and herbaceous yet woody characters, that is papyrus; while the latter is self-explanatory—birch tar, leather bags, even rubber to someone's nose.  Please make no mistake, I am capable to handling papyrus and/or leather as well as the tag-team.  What irritates me is the sharpness and abrasiveness of the two combined, like a piece freshly knocked off from a  boulder and it cut your nerves.  I  would not agree if someone claimed that there is no sandalwood in Santal 33,  but it is not right to say there is either since all the distinctive characters of sandalwood are unfortunately overwhelmed by papyrus and leather, from top to base.  The presentation of the nose and evaluator of Santal 33 really confuses me and the overall effect is chaotic and far from harmony unless you are fond of a very dominant and sadistic leather that has nothing to do with words like rounded, mellow, full-body, smooth. I would like to describe the leather in Santal 33 as cocky, pretentious, smuggling and so forth.  Meanwhile, one may also wish to know the projection would fail you too should you wish to declare such self-absorbed attitude.<br />
<br />
Again this is my idea only, personal it is but if it serves as a security alert before any blind buy, consider the mission accomplished.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="841421"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=841421#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1092342" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1092342" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bfreepro417"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195501"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1195501.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bfreepro417" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Versace-Pour-Homme-Oud-Noir-17338.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17338.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Versace Pour Homme Oud Noir"title="Versace Pour Homme Oud Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1092342ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1092342" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195501">Bfreepro417</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-28">08/28/19 19:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Man, this one smells downright offensive to me. I truly can’t smell any redeeming qualities here.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="1092342"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=1092342#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent821927" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc821927" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LuxAestiva"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/984343"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.984343.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LuxAestiva" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ermenegildo-Zegna/Mediterranean-Neroli-34030.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34030.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mediterranean Neroli"title="Mediterranean Neroli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma821927ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd821927" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/984343">LuxAestiva</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-11">05/11/17 21:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is so cold, sterile and synthetic. Sandalwood is my favorite, but  this not a comforting, warm, creamy, true sandalwood. Some here claim that this smells like Australian sandalwood, but I have a bottle of the essential oil, which I often wear straight, and I can assure that the essential oil fortunately smells nothing like this. Santal 33 reeks of artificial leather and dill with alien impressions of "wood". It screams at you from your wrist forcing you to unsuccessfully try to drown it away with soap and water.<br />
<br />
If that's not bad enough, this smells like every pretentious young "professional" girl fresh out of college who thinks she's edgy and cosmopolitan for moving from the suburbs to the big city (subsidized by daddy of course).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="821927"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=821927#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1207623" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1207623" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Batmanacci"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249505"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1249505.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Batmanacci" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1207623ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1207623" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249505">Batmanacci</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-04">08/04/20 20:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I know frangrances are so subjective, but this in my opinion is one of the most overrated fragrances ever!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="12201"comment_id="1207623"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html?ccid=1207623#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="12201" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.gr").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'ZH') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.asia").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'NL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.nl").replace(/designers/, "ontwerper").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'SR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.punmiris.com").replace(/designers/, "dizajner").replace(/perfume/, "parfem") });
                if (lang == 'RO') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ro").replace(/designers/, "creatori").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'AR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragranticarabia.com").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'UK') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ua").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'MN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.mn").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'HE') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.co.il").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
            });
</script>


<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgH0e5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
</body>
</html>
